intro: Gurania andreana, commonly known as the Andean gurania, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Gurania andreana is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat.
